page.title: 17ALFRED BRAMWELL
page.content: Alfred Bramwell was Headteacher at the Wesleyan Day School in Snaith form 1881 to 1921. On July 29th 1920 he recorded in the school log book that a circus had visited the town and that he had dismissed the children early. His handwriting was clear as usual. The next entry on July 15th shows a marked change of control. The shakiness persists until on April 4th 1921 we are informed of Mr Bramwell's sudden and tragic death. There is a story told that his wife took to her bed many years before as a result of difficulties with their son and immediately Alfred passed away, rose from her bed. Alfred's portrait can be seen in the local Methodist Chapel.
